name: IS9 - Working Near Civil Disturbances
intro: This questionnaire verifies your knowledge of safe and effective operations at incidents where crowd behaviour places personnel and operations at risk, as defined in NCI 29. FENZ personnel must maintain neutrality and prioritize the protection of life and property.

structure.description: Which other organisation(s) should be consulted when attending an incident involving a civil disturbance?
options: Victim Support
Local District Council
New Zealand Police
Fire and Emergency - On Call Executive

structure.description: Which of the following should be included in Approved Local Procedures for attending a civil disturbance?
options: The pre-determined response
Liaison with the police and other emergency services
Water supplies for crowd dispersal
Hostile crowd behaviour / Riots / Protest marches
Any disturbance that develops while Fire and Emergency NZ personnel are attending an incident
Procedures for when working alone
Rescue and protection of persons and property from fire
How to restrain a hostile member of public
Safety of FENZ personnel and the security of fire stations
Expected weather conditions
correctAnswer: The pre-determined response
Liaison with the police and other emergency services
Hostile crowd behaviour / Riots / Protest marches
Any disturbance that develops while Fire and Emergency NZ personnel are attending an incident
Rescue and protection of persons and property from fire
Safety of FENZ personnel and the security of fire stations

structure.description: The role of Fire and Emergency NZ at civil disturbance incidents is to protect life and property, NOT to support the police in quelling riots or enforcing order.
During the readiness or pre-planning phase, what considerations should FENZ and NZ Police address?
options: Containment areas for hostile members of the public
Foster understanding of each other's roles and methods of operation
Agree on local procedures
How many fire crews might be available for crowd dispersal.
Identify potential points of tension in the community
Water supplies for use on protesters
correctAnswer: Foster understanding of each other's roles and methods of operation
Agree on local procedures
Identify potential points of tension in the community

structure.description: When developing predetermined attendance protocols, what are the four criteria required when responding?
options: Use the minimum number of appliances for the initial response
Determine safe and secure response routes
Discuss the fastest way to get there under lights and sirens
Do not use flashing lights and sirens
What riot gear fire-fighters are to wear when responding
Liaise with NZ Police to determine whether a police escort is necessary
correctAnswer: Use the minimum number of appliances for the initial response
Determine safe and secure response routes
Do not use flashing lights and sirens
Liaise with NZ Police to determine whether a police escort is necessary

structure.description: What actions need to be taken when a disturbance develops at an incident that Fire and Emergency NZ personnel are attending?
options: Prepare monitor for crowd dispersal
Establish the whereabouts of all personnel
Withdraw to a safe place
Call station for additional crews
Advise ComCen
Liaise with NZ Police
correctAnswer: Establish the whereabouts of all personnel
Withdraw to a safe place
Advise ComCen
Liaise with NZ Police

structure.description: What PPE should Fire and Emergency NZ personnel wear when in attendance at civil disturbances?
options: Chemical Splash Suits and BA
Level 1s as they allow easier movement
Structural firefighting uniform at all times, with visors down.
structure.correctAnswer: Structural firefighting uniform at all times, with visors down.

structure.description: What three considerations should be put in place, in regards to appliances and firefighting, to enable a quick withdrawal from an incident should the situation deteriorate?
options: Park appliances with the driver remaining in the driver's seat with the engine running
Only use appliance Hose Reels
Use personal lines so that crew don't become separated
Do not use appliance Hose Reels
Use delivery hose from hydrants where the water pressure is sufficient.
correctAnswer: Park appliances with the driver remaining in the driver's seat with the engine running
Do not use appliance Hose Reels
Use delivery hose from hydrants where the water pressure is sufficient.

structure.description: Can operational support staff be used for crowd control duties if requested by OIC Police?
options: If they are available and wearing adequate PPE
If clearance is given by the CFO
No

structure.description: Select the significant hazards that may be faced by crews, both responding to and at, civil disturbance incidents.
options: Backdraught or flashover
Missiles thrown at vehicles
Vehicles hitting barricades
Clandestine Laboratories (Clan Labs)
Vehicles being hi-jacked
Fire bombs
Physical attack
correctAnswer: Missiles thrown at vehicles
Vehicles hitting barricades
Vehicles being hi-jacked
Fire bombs
Physical attack
